caption: This photograph features a close-up of an animal skull heavily encrusted with barnacles and other marine organisms, suggesting it has been submerged in ocean waters for an extended period. The skull, possibly from a small mammal or bird given its size and shape, is placed on a wooden surface with a rough texture, possibly a piece of driftwood or a simple plank. The skull is oriented with the front facing towards the viewer, displaying empty eye sockets and a row of barnacle-encrusted teeth. The background is blurred but hints at a natural outdoor setting with soft, earthy colors that suggest a focus on the skull itself. The overall composition emphasizes the textures and intricate details of the marine growth on the bone, illustrating an intersection of life and death in a natural aquatic environment.
title: Oysters are grown on sticks protruding from Newport estuary to protect them from "ghost shrimp."  The shrimp disturb the oyster beds and suffocate the oysters
